headline: Palantir awarded $795M Army contract modification
summary: Palantir (PLTR) was awarded a $795M modification to a contract for Maven Smart System software licenses. Work locations and funding will be determined with each order, with an estimated completion date of May 28, 2029. Army Contracting Command Aberdeen Proving Ground is the contracting activity. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. headline: Why Shares of Palantir Are Rising Today
summary: The Department of Defense recently announced more potential spending on Palantir's artificial intelligence (AI) technology.  The company's solutions continue to resonate with the DoD, improving operations and the ability to analyze data.  Shares of Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) traded nearly 3% higher as of 10:55 a.m. ET today.

raw.headline: Why Shares of Palantir Are Rising Today

headline: Palantir Stock Stands to Win From Defense Spending, Analysts Say. Its AI Is Key.
summary: Palantir Technologies  stock stands to benefit from deepening ties to the U.S. Department of Defense, including a 166% boost to the budget for one of its artificial intelligence-equipped software systems, analysts said.  William Blair analysts led by Louie DiPalma reiterated a Market Perform rating on the stock Wednesday following an after-hours announcement from the Defense Department.  The agency said it had raised the contract ceiling for  Palantir’s  program that provides Maven Smart System software licenses to the U.S. Combatant Commands by $795 million.

The agency said it had raised the contract ceiling for  Palantir’s  program that provides Maven Smart System software licenses to the U.S. Combatant Commands by $795 million.

headline: Can Palantir Stock Soar 245% to Be a Trillion-Dollar Company? This Wall Street Analyst Has a Surprising Answer.
summary: Dan Ives at Wedbush Securities believes Palantir will be worth $1 trillion within two or three years as it continues to tap demand for artificial intelligence (AI).  Palantir chief technology officer Shyam Sankar says the company is uniquely positioned to deliver on demand for AI due to its software architecture.  Palantir trades at such a rich valuation multiple that its stock price could drop 70% and it would still be tied as the most expensive software stock on the market.
